Lie Groups¶

Special Euclidean and Special Orthogonal Lie groups.

liegroups.SO2¶

class liegroups.so2.SO2(mat=array([[ 1., 0.], [ 0., 1.]]))¶

Rotation matrix in SO(2)

adjoint()¶

Return the adjoint matrix of the rotation.

as_matrix()¶

Return the 2x2 matrix representation of the rotation.

bindto(other)¶

Bind this instance to another instance

dim = 2¶

Dimension of the rotation matrix.

dof = 1¶

Underlying degrees of freedom (i.e., dim of the tangent space).

classmethod exp(phi)¶

Exponential map for SO(2).

Computes a rotation matrix from an angle.

This is the inverse operation to SO2.log.

classmethod from_matrix(mat)¶

Create a SO2 object from a 2x2 rotation matrix.

classmethod fromangle(angle_in_radians)¶

Form a rotation matrix given an angle in rad.

classmethod identity()¶

Return the identity element.

inv()¶

Return the inverse rotation.

classmethod inv_left_jacobian(phi)¶

Inverse left SO(2) Jacobian (see Barfoot/Eade).

classmethod is_valid_matrix(mat)¶

Check if a matrix is a valid rotation matrix.

classmethod left_jacobian(phi)¶

Left SO(2) Jacobian (see Barfoot/Eade).

log()¶

Logarithmic map for SO(3).

Computes an angle from a rotation matrix.

This is the inverse operation to SO2.exp.

mat = None¶

Storage for the rotation matrix

normalize()¶

Normalize the rotation matrix to ensure it is a valid rotation and negate the effect of rounding errors.

perturb(phi)¶

Perturb the rotation on the left by a vector in its local tangent space.

classmethod vee(Phi)¶

SO(2) vee operator as defined by Barfoot.

This is the inverse operation to SO2.wedge.

classmethod wedge(phi)¶

SO(2) wedge operator as defined by Barfoot.

This is the inverse operation to SO2.vee.

liegroups.SE2¶

class liegroups.se2.SE2(rot=[[ 1. 0.] [ 0. 1.]], trans=array([ 0., 0.]))¶

Homogeneous transformation matrix in SE(2)

adjoint()¶

Return the adjoint matrix of the transformation.

as_matrix()¶

Return the 3x3 matrix representation of the transformation.

bindto(other)¶

Bind this instance to another instance

dim = 3¶

Dimension of the rotation matrix.

dof = 3¶

Underlying degrees of freedom (i.e., dim of the tangent space).

classmethod exp(xi)¶

Exponential map for SE(2).

Computes a transformation matrix from SE(2) tangent vector.

This is the inverse operation to SE2.log.

classmethod from_matrix(mat)¶

Create a SE2 object from a 3x3 transformation matrix.

classmethod identity()¶

Return the identity element.

inv()¶

Return the inverse transformation.

classmethod is_valid_matrix(mat)¶

Check if a matrix is a valid transformation matrix.

log()¶

Logarithmic map for SE(2)

Computes a SE(2) tangent vector from a transformation matrix.

This is the inverse operation to SE2.exp.

normalize()¶

Normalize the rotation matrix to ensure it is a valid rotation and negate the effect of rounding errors.

perturb(xi)¶

Perturb the transformation on the left by a vector in its local tangent space.

rot = None¶

Storage for the rotation matrix

trans = None¶

Storage for the translation vector

classmethod vee(Xi)¶

SE(2) vee operator as defined by Barfoot.

This is the inverse operation to SE2.wedge.

classmethod wedge(xi)¶

SE(2) wedge operator as defined by Barfoot.

This is the inverse operation to SE2.vee.

liegroups.SO3¶

class liegroups.so3.SO3(mat=array([[ 1., 0., 0.], [ 0., 1., 0.], [ 0., 0., 1.]]))¶

Rotation matrix in SO(3)

adjoint()¶

Return the adjoint matrix of the rotation.

as_matrix()¶

Return the 3x3 matrix representation of the rotation.

bindto(other)¶

Bind this instance to another instance

dim = 3¶

Dimension of the rotation matrix.

dof = 3¶

Underlying degrees of freedom (i.e., dim of the tangent space).

classmethod exp(phi)¶

Exponential map for SO(3).

Computes a rotation matrix from an axis-angle tangent vector.

This is the inverse operation to SO3.log.

classmethod from_matrix(mat)¶

Create a SO3 object from a 3x3 rotation matrix.

classmethod from_rpy(r, p, y)¶

Form a rotation matrix from RPY Euler angles.

classmethod identity()¶

Return the identity element.

inv()¶

Return the inverse rotation.

classmethod inv_left_jacobian(phi)¶

Inverse left SO(3) Jacobian (see Barfoot).

classmethod is_valid_matrix(mat)¶

Check if a matrix is a valid rotation matrix.

classmethod left_jacobian(phi)¶

Left SO(3) Jacobian (see Barfoot).

log()¶

Logarithmic map for SO(3).

Computes an axis-angle tangent vector from a rotation matrix.

This is the inverse operation to SO3.exp.

mat = None¶

Storage for the rotation matrix

normalize()¶

Normalize the rotation matrix to ensure it is a valid rotation and negate the effect of rounding errors.

perturb(phi)¶

Perturb the rotation on the left by a vector in its local tangent space.

classmethod rotx(angle_in_radians)¶

Form a rotation matrix given an angle in rad about the x-axis.

classmethod roty(angle_in_radians)¶

Form a rotation matrix given an angle in rad about the y-axis.

classmethod rotz(angle_in_radians)¶

Form a rotation matrix given an angle in rad about the z-axis.

classmethod vee(Phi)¶

SO(3) vee operator as defined by Barfoot.

This is the inverse operation to SO3.wedge.

classmethod wedge(phi)¶

SO(3) wedge operator as defined by Barfoot.

This is the inverse operation to SO3.vee.

liegroups.SE3¶

class liegroups.se3.SE3(rot=[[ 1. 0. 0.] [ 0. 1. 0.] [ 0. 0. 1.]], trans=array([ 0., 0., 0.]))¶

Homogeneous transformation matrix in SE(3)

adjoint()¶

Return the adjoint matrix of the transformation.

as_matrix()¶

Return the 4x4 matrix representation of the transformation.

bindto(other)¶

Bind this instance to another instance

dim = 4¶

Dimension of the rotation matrix.

dof = 6¶

Underlying degrees of freedom (i.e., dim of the tangent space).

classmethod exp(xi)¶

Exponential map for SE(3).

Computes a transformation matrix from SE(3) tangent vector.

This is the inverse operation to SE3.log.

classmethod from_matrix(mat)¶

Create a SE3 object from a 4x4 transformation matrix.

classmethod identity()¶

Return the identity element.

inv()¶

Return the inverse transformation.

classmethod is_valid_matrix(mat)¶

Check if a matrix is a valid transformation matrix.

log()¶

Logarithmic map for SE(3)

Computes a SE(3) tangent vector from a transformation matrix.

This is the inverse operation to SE3.exp.

normalize()¶

Normalize the rotation matrix to ensure it is a valid rotation and negate the effect of rounding errors.

perturb(xi)¶

Perturb the transformation on the left by a vector in its local tangent space.

rot = None¶

Storage for the rotation matrix

trans = None¶

Storage for the translation vector

classmethod vee(Xi)¶

SE(3) vee operator as defined by Barfoot.

This is the inverse operation to SE3.wedge.

classmethod wedge(xi)¶

SE(3) wedge operator as defined by Barfoot.

This is the inverse operation to SE3.vee.
